content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully created on the map during this execution. Although several attempts were made to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5), all placement operations failed. Production facilities such as furnaces were referenced for smelting actions; however, these were retrieved from the map (or assumed pre‐existing) and were not newly constructed by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API call errors with get_entities:
  – Use the correct function signature when invoking get_entities. Avoid using unexpected keyword arguments (for example, do not supply “radius”) or extra positional arguments if the API does not support them.
  – When get_entities does not find any entities, use a fallback (such as an empty list) rather than assuming a valid iterable.

• Lab placement and crafting failures:
  – Before attempting to place a Lab (e.g., at (0.5, 2.5)), verify that the Lab exists in your inventory.
  – When crafting a Lab, ensure that all prerequisite components—such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables—are available in sufficient quantities. Review and confirm that the production chains for iron plates, copper plates, and their derivatives are fully operational.
  
• Handling None values:
  – When iterating over results from entity queries, guard against NoneType returns to prevent type errors. Implement a check or fallback to an empty list when no entities are found.
